titles.title: Mäṣḥafä ʾardǝʾǝt “Book of the Disciples” / Tǝmhǝrtä ḫǝbuʾat “Teaching of Mysteries” / Excerpt from Kidan zä-nägh “Covenant of the Morning” / Anaphora of Our Lady by St. Cyriacus of Behnesa / Excerpt from Wǝddase Maryam “Praise of Mary” (?)

shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Mäṣḥafä ʾardǝʾǝt “Book of the Disciples” (The long version beginning with በስመ፡“… ነገር፡ ዘ፲ወ፪አርድእት፡…), (fols. 3ra-40vb l.4) II) Tǝmhǝrtä ḫǝbuʾat “Teaching of Mysteries” (fols. 40va l.5-43vb) III) Excerpt from Kidan zä-nägh “Covenant of the Morning” (ለከ፡ እግዚኦ፡ ለገባሬ፡ ኵሉ፡ አምላክ፡ ንሠፍህ፡ አምላክ፡ ንስፍሕ፡ ነፍስነ፡ ወስብሐተ፡ ዘነግህ፡…), (fols. 43va-vb) (cp. Tǝmhǝrtä ḫǝbuʾat wä-kidan zä-nägh, Addis Abäba 1949 E.C., 13 l.5-14 l.2) IV) Anaphora of Our Lady by St. Cyriacus of Behnesa (fols. 45ra-53vb), incomplete (MQ, Qǝddase Maryam, ch. III, §§ 1-82 l.3) V) Excerpt from Wǝddase Maryam “Praise of Mary” (?) (fol. 54ra-rb).

donors.donor: Wäldä Mikaʾel is mentioned in the supplication formulas. He is also depicted as donor (?) in the miniature, fol. 39v. The names of other individuals are written interlineally or in the upper and bottom margins: Ḥǝrätä ʾAb (?), fol. 11r, Ḫaylä Maryam fol. 15v, priest (qäsis) Gäbrä Śǝllase on fol. 23rb, Gäbrä Mädhǝn on fol. 28v, Täklä Dǝngǝl and Wäldä Giyorgis on fol. 54rb.

dcomments.dcomment: In fol. 46va ʾabba Qerǝllos is mentioned as archbishop (ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡) and ʾabba Ṗeṭros as bishop (ጳጳስ፡). Qerǝllos VI (s. EAE IV, 291) was archbishop of Ethiopia between 1929 and 1937 and Ṗeṭros (s. EAE IV, 140) was bishop of Ethiopia between 1928 and 1936.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. is worn and affected by humidity; the text is partly difficult to read. The sewing is damaged and repaired with synthetic threads. Fols. 36-37 are of a smaller size.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Both boards are finely decorated with a carving (cross, geometric motifs).

bnothers.bnother: Small holes and traces of tiedowns (or tackets?) are visible in the centre fold of some quires, close to the head of the codex.

inks.ink: Black; red (brilliant vermillion; a few times also dark vermillion and vivid red).

squires.squire: A(2/fols. 1r-2v) – I(8/fols. 3r-10v) – II(8/fols. 11r-18v) – III(8/fols. 19r-26v) – IV(8/fols. 27r-34v) – V(4/fols. 35r-38v) – VI(6/fols. 39r-44v) – VII(fols. 45r-52v) – VIII(2; s.l.: 1, stub after 2; 2, stub before 1/fols. 53r-54v).

taunit.ln-info: the number of lines varies from 17 to 19.
taunit.rl-info:
Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling (below in fols. 4r, 4v, 9r, 46r, 53v, 54v). The bottom line is written above the ruling (below in fols. 40r, 40vb).
The ruling is not uniform and regular and the scribe often disregarded it (s., e.g., fols. 46r, 47r). The bottom ruled line has not been used in fol. 41rb.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: The quality of the handwriting differs throughout the Ms. It is characterized by right-sloping letters, with hairlines at the top. The words እግዚአብሔር፡ and እግዚእ፡ are usually written with ligature (e.g., fols. 43vb l.28, 47vb l.4).

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; the name of the archbishop Qerǝllos and of the bishop Ṗeṭros; the name of the donor (?) and other individuals. A few lines (2 or 4) on the incipit page of Texts I, II, and IV (alternating with black lines for Texts I and IV); two lines of the incipit of Texts III and V; initial lines of some sections in Text I and of some paragraphs in Text IV; some words in “Tǝmḫǝrtä ḫǝbuʾat” (Text II); directives for the ministers; titles of Biblical books; words: ʾardǝʾǝt in Text I, ʾab, dǝngǝl and eṗṗes qoṗṗosat in Text IV. Abbreviations; some notes in the margins; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ሃሌ፡/ሃሌ፡ ሉ፡ for ሃሌ፡ ሉያ፡ in Text I (fols. 30va-31ra) ይካ፡ for ይቤ፡ ካህን፡ in Text IV (fols. 47va-48ra) ይዲ፡ for ይቤ፡ ዲያቆን፡ in Text IV (fols. 47rb-48ra) ኦ፡ for ኦድንግል፡ in Text IV (fol. 49vb) አ፡ for አብ፡ in Text IV (fol. 52ra-va)

otherdetails.otherdetail: - Musical notations are written only on fols. 52ra-52vb (within Text IV). - The name of Wäldä Mikaʾel is written over erasures on fols. 30ra, 30rb. - A chain of black and red right-pointing chevrons is used, at the top and over cols. a and b, as decorative band on the incipit page of Text I; sometimes it (or a chain of black and red dots) is also used as sections divider.

extras.extra: - Corrections (omitted words or letters) are written interlineally, e.g., fols. 3vb, 11vb, 31vb, 36vb, 37rb, 40va, 41vb, 52ra. - Spaces for rubricated names are left unfilled: fols. 53rb-53vb. - Erasures in fols. 18rb, 22rb. - Crude minor notes: fols. 1r, 19r, 44r, 54r, 54v. - Pen trial: fol. 1v. - A cotton (red) curtain is sewn to fol. 1v.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Names of the days of the week and of the Evangelists indicating the readings (sometimes written in red and in frames) are written in the upper margin: mǝnbab zä-śänuy: fol. 3r mǝnbab zä-śälus: fols. 7v-8r mǝnbab zä-räbuʿ: fol. 11r mǝnbab zä-ḥamus: fols. 16v-17r mǝnbab zä-ʿarb: fol. 23v mǝnbab zä-qädam: fol. 28v mǝnbab zä-[ʾǝhud]: fol. 31r Wängel zä-Martewos[sic]: fol. 39v zä-Luqas: fol. 39v zä-Marqos: fol. 39v zä-Yoḥannǝs: fol. 40r.

miniature.details: The names of the Apostles are written over their heads. Legend above (from left to right): ፊልጶስ፡ በርተሎሜዎስ፡ ቶማስ፡ ማቴዎስ፡ “Philip, Bartholomew, Thomas, Matthew”. Legend below (from left to right): ጴጥሮስ፡ እንድርያስ፡ ያእቆብ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ “Peter, Andrew, James, John”.

miniature.info: Fol. 38v: (above) Four Apostles; (below) Archangel Michael and the donor (?).
miniature.details: The names of the Apostles are written over their heads. The legends are barely legible. Legend above (from left to right): ታዴ[ዎ]ስ፡ ናትናኤል፡ ማርቆስ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ ዘእልፍ[ዮስ]፡ “Thaddeus, Nathaniel, Mark, James (the son) of Alphaeus”. Legend below (from left to right): [ቅዱስ፡] ሚካኤል፡ “Saint Michael”, ወልደ፡ ሚካ{ኤ}ል፡ [ዘ]ከመ፡ [ተ]ማኅፀነ፡ [n.l.], “How Wäldä Michael entrusted himself …”.
Legend: ሚካኤል፡ [ማርያም፡]: ምስለ፡ ፍቁር፡ ወልዳ፡ ወገብርኤል፡ “Michael, [Mary] with her beloved son and Gabriel”.

miniature.info: Fol. 44v: St. George slaying the dragon.

frames.frame: Fol. 40v (incipit page of Text II): simple coloured (black, red) ornamental band extending up to the upper edge of the page, with a central vertical extension which reaches the bottom of the text and intersects with another horizontal band separating Text I from Text II (interlaces; geometric motifs). Fol. 43v (incipit of Text III): crude black ornamental band (geometric motifs).
